name: ForcemJS
tagline: a toolkit for HTML and Photoshop
body:
[Setup](#setup) | [Options](#options) | [Usage](#usage) | [Example](#example) --- Check out [Forcem Ipsum](http://forcemipsum.com) # Setup ## HTML Include `forcem.js` towards the end of the body tag. ### Basic forcem(); ### Advanced forcem({ class: 'forcem', episode: 4, list: 'characters' }); ## Photoshop Place the `.jsx` files from `/photoshop` into your Photoshop scripts folder. Restart Photoshop if it is running. # HTML Options | Option | Description | Default | | --------- | -------------------------------------- | --------- | | class | Main class for forcem elements | 'forcem' | | episode | Star Wars epsidode #, episodes 4 - 6 | 4 | | list | List type: 'characters' or 'planets' | 'planets' | # Usage ## HTML Set elements class to `forcem`. Use class `p-#` for paragraphs or `li-#` for lists where # is the number of paragraphs or list items you want displayed. ### Paragraphs
### Lists
    ### Images Set `w-#` and `h-#` for width and height. ## Photoshop - Open document in Photoshop. - Create New Layer - Create Text Layer - Select `File -> Script -> Forcemjs Episode *` from the menu     # HTML Example forcem.js
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
